intro: Jussiaea repens f. flaviflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered jussiaea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Onagraceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its prostrate stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Native to South America, it thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners interested in native plants.
